communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Oxnard Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 
 
Thank you for registering with Oxnard CA Public Records Center. 
 
Your Login ID is:  149201-13764608@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HY0DTWkKuIj-2BHi8wCt7a1DDaqndKxKCNzICgX9Dg25kz61SDCPzQjp1ZxSAHt-2F3INFx9Q2WL-2BJmIyCU4R1N7tO8-3DyGE1_9MsTbFgXExQ9lfeeKUdHoGDjdlR-2BpYOiTpW2n-2FKiY-2Bkwmivtt-2BfzIDS-2Blu95aoW-2Bbxi8Fnuff74vNBfFNswwVmk-2BeaqiYoELsU3z2qYWUvRzeaRXQibaVTVW44RyY1TS2Y1PMxle8-2B5TsSiHLFGBmzdPlBb-2BAJTxzE-2FaLGuL4aroA5zQO2euse4FbYkBf4Bwo-2FMrYlQbij6sd5rVWaqAj-2BNXw-2F9UcOFasqkXBnECK4Q-3D)

communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 
Your request was received in this office on 7/16/2023 and given the reference number P000119-071623 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
"To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: NYC.gov - NYC.ID Confirm Your Email Address
communications.communication:
You have just created a user account with City of New York. If it was created in error, deactivate your account. (https://www1.nyc.gov/account/deactivate.htm?guid=097b4fc319a94a3b97fe183fe0b36572&token=gFNkKSlQTXdJILMIjBmwHKHOtNeUpsdfQdfwvMGcmDFJVmPBEgMMZhNaTsEzLOvj&target=aHR0cHM6Ly9hODYwLW9wZW5yZWNvcmRzLm55Yy5nb3Yv) to confirm your email address. (https://www1.nyc.gov/account/validateToken.htm?guid=097b4fc319a94a3b97fe183fe0b36572&token=gFNkKSlQTXdJILMIjBmwHKHOtNeUpsdfQdfwvMGcmDFJVmPBEgMMZhNaTsEzLOvj&target=aHR0cHM6Ly9hODYwLW9wZW5yZWNvcmRzLm55Yy5nb3Yv&spName=OpenRecordsPRD) Click this link 
If the above link does not work, paste the following address into your browser: https://www1.nyc.gov/account/validateToken.htm?guid=097b4fc319a94a3b97fe183fe0b36572&token=gFNkKSlQTXdJILMIjBmwHKHOtNeUpsdfQdfwvMGcmDFJVmPBEgMMZhNaTsEzLOvj&target=aHR0cHM6Ly9hODYwLW9wZW5yZWNvcmRzLm55Yy5nb3Yv&spName=OpenRecordsPRD (https://www1.nyc.gov/account/validateToken.htm?guid=097b4fc319a94a3b97fe183fe0b36572&token=gFNkKSlQTXdJILMIjBmwHKHOtNeUpsdfQdfwvMGcmDFJVmPBEgMMZhNaTsEzLOvj&target=aHR0cHM6Ly9hODYwLW9wZW5yZWNvcmRzLm55Yy5nb3Yv&spName=OpenRecordsPRD) 
We ask you to confirm your email to ensure our emails will be delivered. This is the address you will log in with, and the address to which we will deliver all email messages regarding invitations and requests, and other system mail. 
You can change your email address at any time, but will only be able to log in with it once you have confirmed the email address by clicking the link. 
Thank you for using NYC.gov. 
Do Not Reply - Automatic Email

communications.subject: Your Login Information - DC Government FOIA Portal
communications.communication:
This is an automated message from the DC Government FOIA system. 
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 

Thank for you registering to the District of Columbia Government's Freedom of Information Act Public Access Wesite! You are now able to see your request history and download records. 
A temporary password has been issued and sent to the email address provided. Please check your email for this temporary password and return to https://foia-dc.gov/palMain.aspx to login. Kindly change the temporary password provided by us. 

Regards, 
DC Government FOIA Portal 
Having technical difficulties? Email foia.support@dc.gov or call 202-478-5838 (mailto:foia.support@dc.gov)

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by DC Government FOIA Portal
communications.communication:
This is an automated message from the DC Government FOIA system. 
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 
Request Number 2023-FOIA-07563 has been assigned to the request you submitted. 
In all future correspondence regarding this request, please reference request number 2023-FOIA-07563. To check for status, please log in  https://foia-dc.gov/palMain.aspx and go to Request Status. 
For any questions regarding your request, please contact the FOIA office directly. Find the list of agency Open Governement and FOIA contact information by visiting FOIA Contact Information. For ease of reference, we ask that you have your FOIA Request Number available when you contact the FOIA office. (https://dc.gov/node/818962) 
Regards,DC Government FOIA Portal 
Having technical difficulties? Email or call 202-478-5973 (mailto:foia.support@dc.gov) foia.support@dc.gov

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R057924-071623
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee  Coggins-Prioleau, Thank you for your interest in public records of Mesa AZ Police Department Public Records Center. Your request has been received and is being processed.  Your request was received in this office on 7/16/2023 9:08:05 PM and given the reference number R057924-071623 for tracking purposes. Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  An invoice will be sent 10 - 15 business days after your request has been received and reviewed. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. While requests are processed in the order they are received, several factors including complexity, volume, and incident type requested will effect completion timeline.  These timeframes are subject to change at any time. Currently processing timeframes are as follows: 
 
  *  New Request Review:  10-15 Business days 
  *  Non-Injury Accidents:  2-4 weeks 
  *  Non-Complex incident report requests:  12-14 weeks 
  *  Complex incident report requests: 18-19 weeks 
  *  911/Non-Emergency Calls:  26-28 months 
  *  Audio/Video Media including Body Worn Camera footage:  20-22 months All other requests:  Timeframe is based upon items requested 
< You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed.  Again, thank you for using the Mesa AZ Police Records. Mesa AZ Police Dept Public Records Center: "My Request Center" (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HSV5-2BWCy5honO6BdTAI5einwHyW-2BNUAnvwS1W6FV8f7dvMUN_o-2FEclwY6oeN6NthBjA3kG6klPKN9dnzrKNG51T0pXvI9qL2Pk5ic5WfIL8fTRcfMqwoywJGhs-2FNIXUk9XBGY6uf04ClzlgQyTj4PPnqA-2BGjj6GYgLh0wUbwnpqAB38zWFjqfWQ8WBzlhmFjBQHPeE4x0-2Fhc-2BpV6kaKLq8dZlv-2Ftaf2Qh5nEYYOp-2Bqa74yQUSoIOYBIs45pmLZ2rJb3yYANjw9Fj-2FPPHgeV7nEuWOHp8-3D) 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://mesaazpd.govqa.us/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=57924 (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HSV5-2BWCy5honO6BdTAI5eimALauIga3towg26bdkbuGG8LfZh216opd-2BZLY1afWFt5ojWC-2FWmo1lgA6Y-2F-2FRISyg-3DVdYI_o-2FEclwY6oeN6NthBjA3kG6klPKN9dnzrKNG51T0pXvI9qL2Pk5ic5WfIL8fTRcfMqwoywJGhs-2FNIXUk9XBGY6tie714YoiQIL7esvjBZkNbMwjWKIqymdCSxI3DpzusqMnkc02mpeN9K3gZN-2FrTbjWOteEGJy-2B-2F6azQm0GHBfMMZt1AFT1gc5rnYgqB7w0lEFHjVYSswKSYjQIViVLQqXZhpnitZJharbK-2BHOWVSHwg-3D)

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department)

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Public Record Request Submitted for Public Record Request - Sydnee Prioleau
communications.communication:
Hello Sydnee Prioleau,

Public Record Request Title


Public Record Request - Sydnee Prioleau  


Public Record Request #


NPR2023-0042932 


Name of Requestor


Sydnee Prioleau 


Status


Submitted 


Request Submitted Date


7/17/2023 5:00 PM 






Your Public Record Service Request has been successfully submitted. You will be notified by email if more information or payment is required and when your request is completed. The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department - Public Records Unit hours of operation are 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday, excluding holidays, Juneteenth, Nevada Day, the day after Thanksgiving and December 24th.  Any public record requests made outside of normal business hours will be deemed received the next business day. At any time, you may monitor the status of your request by logging into your Public Records portal account.

***Please note that holidays that fall on a Saturday or Sunday will be observed the preceding Friday or the following Monday. There are 13 holidays that LVMPD observes throughout the year. Based on this information, adjust your request accordingly.

https://lvmpd-portal.dynamics365portals.us/<https://lvmpd.microsoftcrmportals.com>

Thank you,

Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department
400 S. Martin L. King Boulevard
Las Vegas, Nevada  89106
702-828-7489
Monday-Friday 8am to 5pm

communications.subject: City of Indianapolis/Marion County Public Records Request - Justice & Public Safety Records :: P030222-071623
communications.communication:
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of Indianapolis and Marion County. 
 
This message acknowledges your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, Indiana Code chapter 5-14-3-1, et. seq ("APRA"). Your request was received in this office on 7/16/2023 and given the reference number P030222-071623 for tracking purposes. 
You requested the following records: "To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Findianapolis-police-department-660%252Fvehicular-pursuit-policies-indianapolis-metropolitan-police-department-149276%252F%253Femail%253DIMPDRecordsRequest%252540indy.gov&url_auth_token=AAARlTIl8lU8x1kKEnVFfruMiOM%3A1qLFDz%3Ak5apowubXivzpCzJMONo-Pkbt_wOflgAgUFMOlQ3zBk" 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant city or county agency for review and a determination of whether there are public records responsive to your request and, if so, whether those public records are disclosable to you. The city or county agency will contact you concerning your request and inform you whether there are public records responsive to your request, if all or part of those public records are not disclosable to you, and the statutory basis for any denial. Information pertaining to any copying fees that may be related to obtaining copies will be provided. 
Please Note:  With respect to public records requests that include e-mail communications, we want to make you aware that these requests generally take longer than requests for other types of information.  First, the City/County receives a large number of requests for email communications, not just public records requests but also related to legal proceedings.  We rely upon our information technology agency to perform these searches and that agency runs these searches (based  upon reasonably particular search terms as set forth by the State Public Access Counselor) in the order in which the requests are received.  Once the email search is completed, there must also be a review of the content of the email communications to ensure that they are not only responsive to your request but also disclosable.  Finally, disclosable email communications will be produced after this review and if we do not disclose all or part of these email communications, we will provide the statutory bases for such denials as required under the APRA. 
The APRA requires public agencies to produce responsive and disclosable public records, should they exist, within a reasonable time based upon the circumstances.   Please allow the agency time to review and process your request. 
While there is no fixed due date for a response, if more than 30 days have passed since your last communication with the agency, feel free to contact the Public Access Counselor to check the status. 
You may reach the Public Access Counselor at 317.327.4055 or PAC@indy.gov. 
Thank you, 
City of Indianapolis and Marion County

You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Fresno Police Department 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HfI5405t2bA54aoypXnj-2FSO07RI3WToebYy1O5awiQ2k08sKgL16ge67DeHxSRcKX7C5BlSwfeiMJFXKUFBNWCg-3DeY8d_B9KIRnsr8hJXnTniQ5Ktv2lAH6ncBMJhCQwsN1IBv0zC845ThN5Qu4NYmdAnbxETVjCBwrX8dudn9PzDs28EtQyeBQ-2BYl0Kcwp5IEUyiUUEuuYW-2FBJG9q2EXp0yf0YFtMdwMOEvLnpaKvW-2F8TXJVIOWzurBoBzf40KXS-2FkfJJidn3gOu9rwLLOrd3OwMRZe780KyASudeIHOWwJK09gxyStmODViPulnvMOp6kQ3kUYw-2F4o2JhUfxsLCuHSRrWDTabvPB4VtJmqSF6MhFtZdHnVa8w4gWS-2FGbSZ3a1MkPv9yGQS-2B5l9V8Mgl4BPj3v2TolbvV6S8IvjWoPlIo-2BYVivkAc-2B1ElmHGlcrgxc1WJPv5-2BOOAcA7oiz6SIDNkZPdWC4krYHQkVAvZGXqkYlTcww-3D-3D)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Fremont Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau
